column1: Over-the-counter (OTC) medicines are drugs you can buy without a prescription.

You can buy OTC medicines without a prescription in: - Drug stores - Grocery stores - Discount and department stores - Convenience stores - Some gas stations When used properly, OTC medicines can help protect your health by: - Relieving symptoms such as pain, coughing, or diarrhea - Preventing problems like heartburn or motion sickness - Treating conditions such as athletes foot, allergies, or migraine headaches - Providing first aid
